member.name: M:ObjectTK.Buffers.Buffer`1.Orphan(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.BufferUsageHint)
member.summary: "Orphan" the buffer by calling glBufferData() with the exact same size and usage hint, but with a NULL pointer as the new data. This will let OpenGL allocate a new buffer under the same handle and continue using it without synchronization, even if the old buffer may still be in use by commands remaining in the queue.
member.param: The BufferTarget to use when binding the buffer.
The usage hint of the buffer object.

member.summary: Attaches the given texture level to the an attachment point.
member.remarks: If texture is a three-dimensional, cube map array, cube map, one- or two-dimensional array, or two-dimensional multisample array texture the specified texture level is an array of images and the framebuffer attachment is considered to be layered.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Buffers.Framebuffer.Attach(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.FramebufferTarget,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.FramebufferAttachment,ObjectTK.Textures.LayeredTexture,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attaches a single layer of the given texture level to an attachment point.
member.remarks:
Note that for cube maps and cube map arrays the parameter actually indexes the layer-faces.
Thus for cube maps the layer parameter equals the face to be bound.
For cube map arrays the layer parameter can be calculated as 6 * arrayLayer + face, which is done automatically when using the corresponding overload .
member.param: The framebuffer target to bind to.
The attachment point to attach to.
The texture to attach.
The layer of the texture to attach.
The level of the texture to attach.

member.summary: Gets the average value measured for the given query name.

member.name: F:ObjectTK.Queries.QueryMapping`1.ElapsedTimeFactor
member.summary:
Elapsed time is measured in nanoseconds and divided by this factor for better readability.
A factor of 1,000 therefore results in microseconds, a factor of 1,000,000 results in milliseconds.

member.name: F:ObjectTK.Queries.QueryMapping`1.AveragingFactor
member.summary:
Weighting factor used for averaging.
A value close to 1 enables very fast averaging, giving noisy results.
A value close to 0 gives a better mean, reacting much slower to fluctuations in the results.
The default value is 0.05f.
Let the current and the previous query result be A and B, respectively, then the average is calculated with this formula:
average = A * AveragingFactor + B * (1-AveragingFactor);

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Shaders.TransformProgram.FeedbackVaryings(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TransformFeedbackMode,ObjectTK.Shaders.Variables.TransformOut[])
member.summary: Specify values to record in transform feedback buffers.
member.remarks:
Transform feedback varyings must be specified before linking the program. Either specify them in the constructor of the program or call again after a call to this method.
To specify the keywords introduced with advanced interleaving "gl_NextBuffer" and "gl_SkipComponents#" use the TransformOut dummy-instances and , etc.
member.param: Identifies the mode used to capture the varying variables when transform feedback is active. bufferMode must be InterleavedAttribs or SeparateAttribs.
An array of TransformOut objects specifying the varying variables to use for transform feedback.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Shaders.Variables.ImageUniform.Bind(System.Int32,ObjectTK.Textures.LayeredTexture,System.Int32,System.Int32,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureAccess)
member.summary:
Binds a single layer of the given texture level to an image unit.
Note that for cube maps and cube map arrays the parameter actually indexes the layer-faces.
Thus for cube maps the layer parameter equals the face to be bound.
For cube map arrays the layer parameter can be calculated as 6 * arrayLayer + face, which is done automatically when using the corresponding overload .
member.param: The image unit to use.
The texture to bind.
The mipmap level to bind.
The layer of the texture to bind.
Specifies the type of access allowed on the image.

member.summary: Specifies the texture target.

member.name: P:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture.SupportsLayers
member.summary:
Specifies whether this texture supports multiple layers.
True for all texture types derived from LayeredTexture, that is all array, cube map and 3D textures.

member.name: P:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture.SupportsMipmaps
member.summary:
Specifies whether this texture supports mipmap levels.
False for buffer, rectangle and multisample textures, otherwise true.

member.name: P:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture.Levels
member.summary: The number of mipmap levels.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture.GetLevels(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary:
Calculates the maximum number of mipmap levels allowed for the given size in each dimension.
If is greater than zero and less or equal to the calculated maximum it is returned without change.
If is zero the calculated maximum is returned instead.
member.remarks: At the maximum mipmap level the image would consist of exactly one texel, i.e. 1x1 in 2D or 1x1x1 in 3D.
member.param: Specifies the number of desired mipmap levels.
Specifies the size of the textures base image in each dimension.
member.returns: A valid number of mipmap levels.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture.GenerateMipMaps
member.summary: Automatically generates all mipmaps.

member.summary: Sets texture parameters.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture.SetWrapMode(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureWrapMode)
member.summary: Sets the given wrap mode on all dimensions R, S and T.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture.SetFilter(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureMinFilter,OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.TextureMagFilter)
member.summary: Sets the given texture minification and magnification filters.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture.SetDefaultTexParameters
member.summary:
Sets default texture parameters to ensure texture completeness.
Enables mipmapping if the texture supports it, otherwise filtering is set to linear interpolation.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture.SupportsLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Checks if the given mipmap level is supported by this texture.
A supported level is either zero for all textures which do not support mipmapping, or smaller than the number of existing levels.
member.param: The mipmap level of the texture.
member.returns: True if the level is supported, otherwise false.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture.AssertLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Throws an exception if the given mipmap level is not supported by this texture.
The mipmap level must be zero for all texture types which do not support mipmaps.
member.param: Specifies a mipmap level of the texture.

member.summary: Calls GL. to check if there are any errors.

member.name: T:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture1D
member.summary:
Represents a 1D texture.
Images in this texture all are 1-dimensional. They have width, but no height or depth.

member.name: P:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture1D.Width
member.summary: The width of the texture.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture1D.#ctor(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.SizedInternalFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates immutable texture storage with the given parameters.
member.param: The internal format to allocate.
The width of the texture.
The number of mipmap levels.

member.name: T:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture1DArray
member.summary:
Represents a 1D texture array.
Images in this texture all are 1-dimensional. However, it contains multiple sets of 1-dimensional images, all within one texture. The array length is part of the texture's size.

member.name: P:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture1DArray.Width
member.summary: The width of the texture.

member.name: P:ObjectTK.Textures.Texture1DArray.Layers
member.summary:
The number of layers.
note: OpenGL seems to call the second coordinate on a 1D texture array the "height", which would make the whole thing almost exactly equal to a 2D texture with the exception that a 1D texture array can be bound to a framebuffer via glFramebufferTextureLayer().

member.summary: Allocates immutable texture storage with the given parameters.
member.param: The internal format to allocate.
The width of the texture.
The number of layers to allocate.
The number of mipmap levels.

member.name: T:ObjectTK.Textures.TextureCubemap
member.summary:
Represents a cubemap texture.
There are exactly 6 distinct sets of 2D images, all of the same size. They act as 6 faces of a cube.

member.name: P:ObjectTK.Textures.TextureCubemap.Size
member.summary:
The size of the texture.
This represents both width and height of the texture, because cube maps have to be square.

member.summary: Allocates immutable texture storage with the given parameters.

The width and height of the cube map faces.
The number of mipmap levels.

member.name: T:ObjectTK.Textures.TextureCubemapArray
member.summary:
Represents a cubemap texture array.
Images in this texture are all cube maps. It contains multiple sets of cube maps, all within one texture. The array length * 6 (number of cube faces) is part of the texture size.

member.name: P:ObjectTK.Textures.TextureCubemapArray.Size
member.summary:
The size of the texture.
This represents both width and height of the texture, because cube maps have to be square.

member.name: T:ObjectTK.Textures.TextureFactory
member.summary: Provides methods for creating texture objects in ways not covered by constructors.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Textures.TextureFactory.AquireTexture2D(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Creates a new Texture2D instance using the given texture handle.
The width, height and internal format are queried from OpenGL and passed to the instance. The number of mipmap levels can not be queried and must be specified, otherwise it is set to one. TODO: somehow find out the number of mipmap levels because otherwise does not work correctly.
member.param: An active handle to a 2D texture.
The number of mipmap levels.
member.returns: A new Texture2D instance.

member.name: M:ObjectTK.Textures.TextureFactory.CalculateMaxMipmapLevels(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Calculates the maximum number of mipmap levels allowed, based on the size of all dimensions given.
member.param: Specifies the size in all dimensions.
member.returns: The maximum number of mipmap levels allowed. The last level would consist of 1 texel.
